div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 12:35 pm CDT

div.div: Sunny, with a high near 70. North wind 9 to 11 mph.

Showers and thunderstorms likely, mainly before 2am. Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming mostly clear, with a low around 41. North northeast wind 8 to 13 mph becoming light and variable. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.
Mostly sunny, with a high near 72. West wind 5 to 7 mph becoming calm.

div.div: Due to recomendtions from KSDE and other sources USD 217 will be closing the doors for the rest of the year. Students check your email for learning information.

span.b: TEACHING POSITION AVAILABLE
HIGH SCHOOL BUSINESS TEACHER
QUALIFICATIONS: Kansas Teacher Certification in Business
Education, Computers – FACS Vocational Education Certification is a Plus
SALARY: Commensurate with preparation &
experience. 2020-2021 starting salary (BS, Step 1) is $40,385. DEADLINE FOR APPLICATIONS: Open until position is filled
ADDITIONAL Supplemental positions may be available,
but not required. INFORMATION: School owned housing available and rent
free for the first year of employment. District participation in BCBS health plan includes a $250.00 monthly fringe benefit.
FOR INQUIRES AND/OR AN APPLICATION, PLEASE CALL OR WRITE:
John Barrett, Superintendent USD 217 PO Box 167 Rolla, KS 67954 Phone (620) 593-4344 Fax (620) 593-4250 E-mail: jbarrett@usd217.org
4/16/2020 X:\Our District Office Documents\Jobposads\HS Business.doc 1
TEACHING POSITION AVAILABLE
JH/HS SCIENCE USD 217 ROLLA, KS
QUALIFICATIONS: Kansas Teacher Certification in the
following areas:
• Chemistry
• Physical Science
• Physics
• Biology
BASE SALARY: Commensurate with preparation and experience.
2020-21 Starting salary (BS, Step 1) is $40,385
District owned housing is available and rent free for the first year of employment.
District participation in BCBS health plan comes with a $250.00 monthly fringe benefit.
DEADLINE FOR APPLICATIONS: Open until position is filled.
FOR INQUIRIES AND/OR AN APPLICATION, PLEASE CALL OR WRITE:
John Barrett, Superintendent USD 217 P.O. Box 167 Rolla, KS 67954 Phone (620) 593-4344 Fax (620) 593-4250
POSITION AVAILABLE
BOARD OF EDUCATION CLERK & DISTRICT OFFICE SECRETARY
USD 217 ROLLA, KANSAS
JOB TITLE: Board of Education Clerk /Superintendent
Secretary
TERM: 12-Month Position, Hours to be determined
GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES: *Legal Clerk Responsibilities
*Serve as Secretary to Superintendent *Responsible for Preparing Monthly
Warrants & Payroll *Prepare Board Reports and Packets *Human Resources *Custodian of Records *Required State Reporting
QUALIFICATIONS: *Excellent People Skills
*Flexibility and Adaptability *Computer Experience Necessary *Excellent Organizational & Attention to Detail *Fund Accounting Experience *Preferred Associates Degree or Higher

span.span: Update on Continuous Learning at Rolla Schools

We are currently scheduling times for Wednesday, March 25 for students to come to the school to retrieve their belongings, to check out a school-issued Chromebook or iPad, and to go over expectations for our Continuous Learning model. When you come to the school, please bring with you all materials that belong to the school that are checked out to you. This includes library books, uniforms, band instruments, and other items. Wednesday may be a hectic day, so please be patient with us and with each other.
Actualización sobre aprendizaje continuo en las escuelas de Rolla

Actualmente estamos programando horarios para el miércoles 25 de marzo para que los estudiantes vengan a la escuela a recuperar sus pertenencias, revisen un Chromebook o iPad emitido por la escuela y superen las expectativas de nuestro modelo de Aprendizaje continuo. Cuando vengas a la escuela, trae contigo todos los materiales que pertenecen a la escuela que te hayan prestado. Esto incluye libros de la biblioteca, uniformes, instrumentos de banda y otros artículos. El miércoles puede ser un día agitado, así que tengan paciencia con nosotros y entre nosotros.

p.b: USD 217 Food Service
Rolla Schools will be serving GRAB & GO Breakfast and Lunch
Monday - Friday March 23rd - May 14 (Except April 10 and April 13)
All children ages 0-18 and WHO LIVE IN THE DISTRICT are eligible.
Adults: Breakfast $3.00; Lunch $4.00 (prepaid by arrangement)
Breakfast served - 8:00 am to 9:00 am Lunch served - Noon to 1:00 pm
Drive-up or walk-up only (delivery available to bus routes) Back door of the school kitchen by the high school entrance
Students getting the meals must be present in order to pick them up.
To sign up: email jbarrett@usd217.org with the following information
Name of student(s), children, and adults needing meals Any food allergies Phone # and email address to be reached.
Note: If you sign up for delivery, you will receive meals each day.
USD 217 Servicio de Alimentos
Las escuelas de Rolla servirán desayuno y almuerzo GRAB & GO
Lunes - viernes 23 de marzo - 14 de mayo (Excepto el 10 de abril y el 13 de abril)
Todos los niños de 0 a 18 años y QUIEN VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO son elegibles.
Adultos: Desayuno $ 3.00; Almuerzo $ 4.00 (prepago por acuerdo)
Desayuno servido - 8:00 a.m. a 9:00 a.m. Almuerzo servido - Mediodía a 1:00 pm
Solo en coche o sin cita (entrega disponible para rutas de autobús) Puerta trasera de la cocina de la escuela junto a la entrada de la escuela secundaria.
Los estudiantes que reciben las comidas deben estar presentes para poder recogerlos.
Para registrarse: envíe un correo electrónico a jbarrett@usd217.org con la siguiente información
Nombre del estudiante (s), niños y adultos que necesitan comidas Cualquier alergia alimentaria Número de teléfono y dirección de correo electrónico a contactar.
Nota: Si se registra para la entrega, recibirá comidas todos los días.
Internet Service

For families with school aged children who do not have internet access, please call Pioneer Communications at (620) 544-4392 to request service. Pioneer will gather the necessary information to ship the items you will need to install to get internet access. They will provide instructions and you can call them for assistance. They are waiving the installation fee and will provide the service for free until May 31st, 2020.
John Barrett, Superintendent
USD 217 Rolla Schools
Servicio de Internet

Para familias con niños en edad escolar que no tienen acceso a Internet, llame a Pioneer Communications al (620) 544-4392 para solicitar servicio. Pioneer reunirá la información necesaria para enviar los artículos que necesitará instalar para obtener acceso a Internet. Proporcionarán instrucciones y puede llamarlos para obtener ayuda. Están renunciando a la tarifa de instalación y proporcionarán el servicio de forma gratuita hasta el 31 de mayo de 2020.
John Barrett, Superintendente
USD 217 Escuelas Rolla

td.h1: Spread the word to farmers today!

td.p:
When a farmer nominates your school district,
you have a chance to win a Grow Rural Education
$15,000 STEM grant, sponsored by the Bayer Fund.
Just imagine what that money could do for your students to enhance STEM education!
To learn more about the Grow Rural Education program, visit americasfarmers.com.
Get a farmer to nominate your school district by April 1!

p.em: Copyright © 2020 Bayer Fund, All rights reserved.
p.br:
You are receiving this email because your school district has a chance to participate in an America's Farmers program.
Our mailing address is:
Bayer Fund

td.p:
Saint Louis, MO 63167-1000
Add us to your address book
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can update your preferences or unsubscribe from this list.
